title: Drawing, second or third quarter of 18th century
date: second or third quarter of 18th century
medium: Graphite, pen and ink, brush and gray watercolor
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The structure has three stories and a balustrade above the entablature to hide the roof. It stands in front of another building, the upper side of which is visible behind the balustrade. At left is the section, contiguous to the façade showing alternative suggestions. Four pairs of pilasters flank three open archways, each having in the interval a door or a window, respectively. In front of the façade a fountain.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, second or third quarter of 18th century. Graphite, pen and ink, brush and gray watercolor. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7421.
